children.value: We recommend installing Primer CSS with npm:
Primer CSS requires npm version 3 or above. You can check which version you have by running
. If you have a version that's older than 3.0, you can update it with
Begin by initializing your project with a
file. You can read more on how to do this
Install the Primer CSS npm package modules by running
. This will install all of the SCSS source files into the
If you have an older version, follow the instructions in the
Once you have Jekyll up and running, you will need to add this configuration to your
file. This let's the sass compiler know where your code lives.

sass:
  # Where you keep your scss files
  sass_dir: assets/css/
  # Where sass should look for other scss
  load_paths:
    - node_modules/
It's best practice to import all of this scss into one file, usually named
. From this file you'll import one or more Primer CSS bundles and any other custom code you write.
Here's an example of how it might look if you installed only a few Primer CSS components with some custom variable overrides. The
uses the default primer blue in the text utilities, then the new blue in
Don't forget to add the compiled CSS to the
Using Primer CSS on a static site
You won't need to install any node modules or Sass compilers for a static site; you can use the built CSS. The best thing to do is to
and host it yourself. If that's not an option, you can include a CDN link in your HTML:
